How the loop operates in the field

Consent-first orchestration

VALVE and CLASP keep permissions explicit, revocable, and cryptographically signed before any model wakes up.

  • Shared ROOT receipts anchor every run.
  • VALVE emits legible refusal codes.
  • CLASP packages consent envelopes for reuse.

Receipts and provenance by default

TRACE and COMPOST guarantee every span leaves evidence you can replay, inspect, and disclose without breaking flow.

  • TRACE spans chain hash receipts and telemetry.
  • MIRE + SCAR surface risk and compliance drift.
  • COMPOST publishes immutable audit logs.

Learning from lived practice

ECHO instruments the reflex loop so Labs, founders, and communities can listen for emergent traits and adapt.

  • Reflex dashboards tie SPORE exports back to ROOT.
  • ECHO tracks what repairs land, where drift repeats.
  • SPORE shares portable bundles with attribution.

This public site is growing alongside the vNext narrative. Expect refreshed pathways into Labs, orchestration primitives, and community programs in upcoming drops.

  • Labs pilot briefings — wastewater intelligence, bio-digital interop, consent tooling.
  • Consent pattern catalog — reusable CLASP and VALVE schematics (in review).
  • Community interop playground — ECHO-instrumented collaboration spaces.
